SEARCH
Package com.rocket.radar.events

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.rocket.radar.events.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single event in the application.

This class serves as a data model for event information, including details about the event, scheduling, registration, and user participation. It is designed to be serialized for passing between Android components (e.g., Fragments) and is compatible with Google Firestore for database operations. The Serializable interface allows Event objects to be passed in Bundles.

A Event.Builder class is provided for flexible object creation.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor required for Firestore data mapping. Initializes transient fields to null.

    • Event

      public Event(String eventTitle, Date date, String tagline, String description, int image)
      Constructs a new Event with essential details. A unique event ID is automatically generated.
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - The title of the event.
      date - The start date of the event.
      tagline - A short, catchy phrase for the event.
      description - A detailed description of the event.
      image - A local drawable resource ID for a placeholder image.

      public int getImage()
      Gets the local drawable resource ID for the event's image. This method is annotated with Exclude to prevent the image field from being serialized and stored in Firestore, as it is a local resource identifier.
      Returns:
      The integer ID of the drawable resource.
